chapters.title: CHAPTER I. A CASTLE IN THE AIR
content: On a fine afternoon in the spring, a young man of pleasing exterior, but with an expression of such deep gloom on his face that he might have been a tidy-minded Cain, was leaning over the battlements of Blandings Castle. He was gazing into the middle distance with a moody frown. A more energetic man would have cursed. This young man had not the energy. He merely brooded.
A voice at his elbow broke in upon his thoughts.
The young man turned. A solidly-built, elderly man, with a round, red, clean-shaven face and an air of comfortable prosperity, was standing beside him.
“Nice view from here,” said the elderly man.
